did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: First Presbyterian Church of Hector records, 1809-1924.

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: First Presbyterian Church of Hector (Hector, N.Y.)

did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Two volumes of session meeting minutes (1809-1839, 1840-1924); trustee meeting minutes, annual meeting minutes, financial records including the constitution and a list of members of the Women's Home Missionary Society (1834-1876); dues lists of the Ladies Missionary Society of Peach Orchard.

bioghist.head: ORGANIZATIONAL HISTORY
bioghist.p: This church was constituted with seven members as the Presbyterian Church of Peach Orchard on September 15, 1809 by the Reverend Mr. William Clark and the Reverend Mr. Charles Mosher. Elders and deacons were elected on October 29, 1809. On February 23, 1810 trustees were elected and the church's name was changed to the First Presbyterian Church of Hector. In 1817 the trustees purchased a lot for a cemetery and in 1818 a church was built. In 1853 the building was repaired at a cost of $1,400.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Two volumes of session meeting minutes (1809-1839, 1840-1924); trustee meeting minutes, annual meeting minutes, financial records including the constitution and a list of members of the Women's Home Missionary Society (1834-1876); dues lists of the Ladies Missionary Society of Peach Orchard.
